content:
EncryptedXml Class

Definition

Represents the process model for implementing XML encryption.

In this Article

public class EncryptedXml
Inheritance
System.Object
EncryptedXml

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The EncryptedXml class is the main class used for XML encryption in the .NET Framework. XML Encryption is a standards-based, interoperable way to encrypt all or part of an XML document or any arbitrary data. The .NET Framework XML encryption classes implement the World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) specification for XML encryption located at http://www.w3.org/TR/xmlenc-core/.

Use the EncryptedXml class whenever you need to share encrypted XML data between applications or organizations in a standard way. Any data encrypted using this class can be decrypted by any implementation of the W3C specification for XML encryption.

XML encryption replaces any plain text XML element or document with the <EncryptedData> element, which contains an encrypted (or cipher text) representation of plain text XML or any arbitrary data. The <EncryptedData> element can optionally contain information about where to find a key that will decrypt the cipher text, and which cryptographic algorithm was used to encrypt the plain text.

The <EncryptedKey> element is similar to the <EncryptedData> element in style and usage, except that it allows you to encrypt a key that will decrypt the value of the <EncryptedData> element. Note that the <EncryptedKey> element and the <EncryptedData> element will never contain an unencrypted key.

Use one of the following methods to exchange key information:

  • Do not include any key information. If you choose this option, both parties must agree on an algorithm and key before they exchange encrypted data.

  • Include the location of the key in the Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) attribute of the <RetrievalMethod> element. Both parties must agree on the key location ahead of time and this location must be kept secret.

  • Include a string name that maps to a key in the <KeyName> element. Both parties must agree on the key name mapping before they exchange encrypted data and this mapping must be kept secret.

  • Include an encrypted key in the <EncryptedKey> element. Both parties must agree on the key that decrypts the encrypted key before they exchange encrypted data. You can optionally include a name or location of the key that will decrypt the key in the <EncryptedKey> element.

Constructors

EncryptedXml()

Initializes a new instance of the EncryptedXml class.

public EncryptedXml ();

Remarks

This is the default constructor for the main class for XML encryption in the .NET Framework.

EncryptedXml(XmlDocument)

Initializes a new instance of the EncryptedXml class using the specified XML document.

public EncryptedXml (System.Xml.XmlDocument document);
document
XmlDocument

An XmlDocument object used to initialize the EncryptedXml object.

Remarks

Use this constructor to create an EncryptedXml object when you want to specify the XML document to encrypt. The document parameter comprises the XML elements that later form the encrypted XML.

EncryptedXml(XmlDocument,Evidence)

Initializes a new instance of the EncryptedXml class using the specified XML document and evidence.

public EncryptedXml (System.Xml.XmlDocument document, System.Security.Policy.Evidence evidence);
document
XmlDocument

An XmlDocument object used to initialize the EncryptedXml object.

evidence
Evidence

An Evidence object associated with the XmlDocument object.

Remarks

Use this constructor to create an EncryptedXml object when you want to specify the XML document to encrypt and provide security evidence. The document parameter comprises the XML elements that later form the encrypted XML.

Fields

XmlEncAES128KeyWrapUrl

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the 128-bit Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) Key Wrap algorithm (also known as the Rijndael Key Wrap algorithm). This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncAES128KeyWrapUrl;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncAES128KeyWrapUrl field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#kw-aes128".

XmlEncAES128Url

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the 128-bit Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm (also known as the Rijndael algorithm). This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncAES128Url;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncAES128Url field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#aes128-cbc".

XmlEncAES192KeyWrapUrl

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the 192-bit Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) Key Wrap algorithm (also known as the Rijndael Key Wrap algorithm). This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncAES192KeyWrapUrl;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncAES192KeyWrapUrl field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#kw-aes192".

XmlEncAES192Url

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the 192-bit Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm (also known as the Rijndael algorithm). This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncAES192Url;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncAES192Url field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#aes192-cbc".

XmlEncAES256KeyWrapUrl

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the 256-bit Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) Key Wrap algorithm (also known as the Rijndael Key Wrap algorithm). This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncAES256KeyWrapUrl;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncAES256KeyWrapUrl field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#kw-aes256".

XmlEncAES256Url

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the 256-bit Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) algorithm (also known as the Rijndael algorithm). This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncAES256Url;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncAES256Url field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#aes256-cbc".

XmlEncDESUrl

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the Digital Encryption Standard (DES) algorithm. This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncDESUrl;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncDESUrl field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#des-cbc".

XmlEncElementContentUrl

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for XML encryption element content. This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncElementContentUrl;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncElementContentUrl field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#Content".

XmlEncElementUrl

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for an XML encryption element. This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncElementUrl;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncElementUrl field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#Element".

XmlEncEncryptedKeyUrl

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the XML encryption <EncryptedKey> element. This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncEncryptedKeyUrl;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncEncryptedKeyUrl field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#EncryptedKey".

XmlEncNamespaceUrl

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for XML encryption syntax and processing. This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncNamespaceUrl;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncNamespaceUrl field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#".

XmlEncRSA15Url

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the RSA Public Key Cryptography Standard (PKCS) Version 1.5 algorithm. This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncRSA15Url;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncRSA15Url field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-1_5".

XmlEncRSAOAEPUrl

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the RSA Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding (OAEP) encryption algorithm. This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncRSAOAEPUrl;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncRSAOAEPUrl field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#rsa-oaep-mgf1p".

XmlEncSHA256Url

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the SHA-256 algorithm. This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncSHA256Url;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncSHA256Url field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#sha256".

XmlEncSHA512Url

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the SHA-512 algorithm. This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncSHA512Url;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncSHA512Url field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#sha512".

XmlEncTripleDESKeyWrapUrl

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the TRIPLEDES key wrap algorithm. This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncTripleDESKeyWrapUrl;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncTripleDESKeyWrapUrl field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#kw-tripledes".

XmlEncTripleDESUrl

Represents the namespace Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for the Triple DES algorithm. This field is constant.

public const string XmlEncTripleDESUrl;

Remarks

The value of the XmlEncTripleDESUrl field is "http://www.w3.org/2001/04/xmlenc#tripledes-cbc".

Properties

DocumentEvidence

Gets or sets the evidence of the XmlDocument object from which the EncryptedXml object is constructed.

public System.Security.Policy.Evidence DocumentEvidence { get; set; }
Value
Evidence

An Evidence object.

Remarks

If the XML document used to create the EncryptedXml object has any security evidence, you should add the evidence to the DocumentEvidence property. If you do not set this property, any associated CipherReference objects will not be dereferenced because they will not be granted the required permission set.

Encoding

Gets or sets the encoding used for XML encryption.

public System.Text.Encoding Encoding { get; set; }
Value
Encoding

An Encoding object.

Remarks

UTF-8 encoding is the default encoding for XML encryption. You can use this property to specify other types of encoding from the Encoding class, such as UTF-16 or ASCII.

Mode

Gets or sets the cipher mode used for XML encryption.

public System.Security.Cryptography.CipherMode Mode { get; set; }
Value
CipherMode

One of the CipherMode values.

Remarks

Cipher Block Chaining (CBC) mode is the default cipher mode for XML encryption. You can use this property to specify other cipher modes of the CipherMode enumeration, such as Cipher Feedback (CFB) mode.

Padding

Gets or sets the padding mode used for XML encryption.

public System.Security.Cryptography.PaddingMode Padding { get; set; }
Value
PaddingMode

One of the PaddingMode values that specifies the type of padding used for encryption.

Remarks

ISO-10126 padding is the default padding mode for XML encryption. You can use this property to specify other padding modes of the PaddingMode enumeration, such as ANSI X9.23 or PKCS#5.

Recipient

Gets or sets the recipient of the encrypted key information.

public string Recipient { get; set; }
Value
String

The recipient of the encrypted key information.

Remarks

You can access the EncryptedXml object referenced by a key name by examining the CarriedKeyName property.

Use the Recipient property to identify the EncryptedXml element that the current recipient can decrypt to retrieve a decryption key.

Resolver

Gets or sets the XmlResolver object used by the Document Object Model (DOM) to resolve external XML references.

public System.Xml.XmlResolver Resolver { get; set; }
Value
XmlResolver

An XmlResolver object.

Remarks

This property contains an XmlResolver object used to resolve external XML resources such as entities, document type definitions (DTDs), or schemas.

XmlDSigSearchDepth

Gets or sets the XML digital signature recursion depth to prevent infinite recursion and stack overflow. This might happen if the digital signature XML contains the URI which then points back to the original XML.

public int XmlDSigSearchDepth { get; set; }
Value
Int32

Returns Int32.

Methods

AddKeyNameMapping(String,Object)

Defines a mapping between a key name and a symmetric key or an asymmetric key.

public void AddKeyNameMapping (string keyName, object keyObject);
keyName
String

The name to map to keyObject.

keyObject
System.Object

The symmetric key to map to keyName.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the keyName parameter is null.

-or-

The value of the keyObject parameter is null.

CryptographicException

The value of the keyObject parameter is not an RSA algorithm or a symmetric key.

Remarks

The AddKeyNameMapping method allows you to map a symmetric key or an asymmetric key to a string name. This method adds the values of the keyName and keyObject parameters to a table of valid key name mappings.

Use the ClearKeyNameMappings method to clear the key name mappings table.

ClearKeyNameMappings()

Resets all key name mapping.

public void ClearKeyNameMappings ();

Remarks

Use this method to clear all key name mapping that you have set using the AddKeyNameMapping method.

DecryptData(EncryptedData,SymmetricAlgorithm)

Decrypts an <EncryptedData> element using the specified symmetric algorithm.

public byte[] DecryptData (System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData encryptedData, System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm symmetricAlgorithm);
encryptedData
EncryptedData

The data to decrypt.

symmetricAlgorithm
SymmetricAlgorithm

The symmetric key used to decrypt encryptedData.

Returns
Byte[]

A byte array that contains the raw decrypted plain text.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the encryptedData parameter is null.

-or-

The value of the symmetricAlgorithm parameter is null.

Remarks

Use the DecryptData method to decrypt an EncryptedData element using a symmetric key.

Note that the DecryptData method only decrypts top-level <EncryptedData> tags. In cases where one or more <EncryptedData> tags have been encrypted and are contained within higher level <EncryptedData> tags, you can call the DecryptDocument method separately for each one. See the DecryptDocument method for a code example.

DecryptDocument()

Decrypts all <EncryptedData> elements of the XML document that were specified during initialization of the EncryptedXml class.

public void DecryptDocument ();
Exceptions
CryptographicException

The cryptographic key used to decrypt the document was not found.

Remarks

The DecryptDocument method decrypts all <EncryptedData> elements of the XML document loaded during initialization. After you call this method, all <EncryptedData> elements in the document are replaced with plain text versions.

The DecryptDocument method decrypts only top-level <EncryptedData> elements. If you need to decrypt a super-encrypted document (a document that is encrypted more than once), you must call the DecryptDocument method repeatedly until all the <EncryptedData> elements have been decrypted.

Note

The DecryptDocument method decrypts only valid XML data. To decrypt arbitrary data, use the DecryptData method.

To use XML Encryption with X.509 certificates, you must have the Microsoft Enhanced Cryptographic Provider installed and the X.509 certificate must use the Enhanced Provider. If you do not have the Microsoft Enhanced Cryptographic Provider installed or the X.509 certificate does not use the Enhanced Provider, a CryptographicException with an "Unknown Error" will be thrown when you decrypt an XML document.

DecryptEncryptedKey(EncryptedKey)

Determines the key represented by the EncryptedKey element.

public virtual byte[] DecryptEncryptedKey (System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedKey encryptedKey);
encryptedKey
EncryptedKey

The EncryptedKey object that contains the key to retrieve.

Returns
Byte[]

A byte array that contains the key.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the encryptedKey parameter is null.

CryptographicException

The value of the encryptedKey parameter is not the Triple DES Key Wrap algorithm or the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) Key Wrap algorithm (also called Rijndael).

Remarks

The DecryptEncryptedKey method decrypts an encrypted key contained within the <EncryptedKey> element of an XML document.

This recursive method finds the key represented by the EncryptedKey object. Note that an EncryptedKey object can contain another EncryptedKey object that specifies its KeyInfo value.

DecryptKey(Byte[],SymmetricAlgorithm)

Decrypts an <EncryptedKey> element using a symmetric algorithm.

public static byte[] DecryptKey (byte[] keyData, System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm symmetricAlgorithm);
keyData
Byte[]

An array of bytes that represents an encrypted <EncryptedKey> element.

symmetricAlgorithm
SymmetricAlgorithm

The symmetric key used to decrypt keyData.

Returns
Byte[]

A byte array that contains the plain text key.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the keyData parameter is null.

-or-

The value of the symmetricAlgorithm parameter is null.

CryptographicException

The value of the symmetricAlgorithm element is not the Triple DES Key Wrap algorithm or the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) Key Wrap algorithm (also called Rijndael).

Remarks

The DecryptKey method decrypts an encrypted key contained within the <EncryptedKey> element of an XML document. This method accepts a value for the symmetricAlgorithm parameter that represents either the Triple DES algorithm or the AES key wrap algorithm (also called Rijndael).

DecryptKey(Byte[],RSA,Boolean)

Decrypts an <EncryptedKey> element using an asymmetric algorithm.

public static byte[] DecryptKey (byte[] keyData, System.Security.Cryptography.RSA rsa, bool useOAEP);
keyData
Byte[]

An array of bytes that represents an encrypted <EncryptedKey> element.

rsa
RSA

The asymmetric key used to decrypt keyData.

useOAEP
Boolean

A value that specifies whether to use Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding (OAEP).

Returns
Byte[]

A byte array that contains the plain text key.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the keyData parameter is null.

-or-

The value of the rsa parameter is null.

Remarks

The DecryptKey method decrypts an encrypted key contained within the <EncryptedKey> element of an XML document. This method accepts a value for the rsa parameter that represents either the RSA PKCS#1 v1.5 algorithm or the RSA PKCS#1 type 2 algorithm (also called OAEP padding).

Encrypt(XmlElement,X509Certificate2)

Encrypts the outer XML of an element using the specified X.509 certificate.

public System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData Encrypt (System.Xml.XmlElement inputElement, System.Security.Cryptography.X509Certificates.X509Certificate2 certificate);
inputElement
XmlElement

The XML element to encrypt.

certificate
X509Certificate2

The X.509 certificate to use for encryption.

Returns
EncryptedData

An EncryptedData element that represents the encrypted XML data.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the inputElement parameter is null.

-or-

The value of the certificate parameter is null.

NotSupportedException

The value of the certificate parameter does not represent an RSA key algorithm.

Remarks

The Encrypt method is a convenient way to encrypt the outer XML of an element using a certificate. This method generates a 256-bit Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) session key to encrypt an XML element and then encrypts and signs the AES key using the X509Certificate2 object. The Encrypt method then returns the resulting XML as an EncryptedData element.

If you need more control over the encryption, so you can place the encrypted information into a <CipherReference> element or specify whether the entire XML element or just its contents should be encrypted, use the EncryptData method overloads.

To use XML Encryption with X.509 certificates, you must have the Microsoft Enhanced Cryptographic Provider installed and the X.509 certificate must use the Enhanced Provider. If you do not have the Microsoft Enhanced Cryptographic Provider installed or the X.509 certificate does not use the Enhanced Provider, a CryptographicException with an "Unknown Error" will be thrown when you decrypt an XML document.

Encrypt(XmlElement,String)

Encrypts the outer XML of an element using the specified key in the key mapping table.

public System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData Encrypt (System.Xml.XmlElement inputElement, string keyName);
inputElement
XmlElement

The XML element to encrypt.

keyName
String

A key name that can be found in the key mapping table.

Returns
EncryptedData

An EncryptedData object that represents the encrypted XML data.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the inputElement parameter is null.

-or-

The value of the keyName parameter is null.

CryptographicException

The value of the keyName parameter does not match a registered key name pair.

-or-

The cryptographic key described by the keyName parameter is not supported.

Remarks

This method is a convenient way to encrypt the outer XML of an element using a key name. If you need more control over the encryption, so you can place the encrypted information into a <CipherReference> element or specify whether the entire XML element or just its contents should be encrypted, use the EncryptData method overloads.

For a list of all supported algorithms, see the list of constant fields associated with the EncryptedXml class.

EncryptData(Byte[],SymmetricAlgorithm)

Encrypts data in the specified byte array using the specified symmetric algorithm.

public byte[] EncryptData (byte[] plaintext, System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm symmetricAlgorithm);
plaintext
Byte[]

The data to encrypt.

symmetricAlgorithm
SymmetricAlgorithm

The symmetric algorithm to use for encryption.

Returns
Byte[]

A byte array of encrypted data.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the plaintext parameter is null.

-or-

The value of the symmetricAlgorithm parameter is null.

CryptographicException

The data could not be encrypted using the specified parameters.

Remarks

The returned byte array can be placed into a <CipherValue> element. This method assumes that the data specified in the plaintext parameter is a byte array that contains XML data.

EncryptData(XmlElement,SymmetricAlgorithm,Boolean)

Encrypts the specified element or its contents using the specified symmetric algorithm.

public byte[] EncryptData (System.Xml.XmlElement inputElement, System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm symmetricAlgorithm, bool content);
inputElement
XmlElement

The element or its contents to encrypt.

symmetricAlgorithm
SymmetricAlgorithm

The symmetric algorithm to use for encryption.

content
Boolean

true to encrypt only the contents of the element; false to encrypt the entire element.

Returns
Byte[]

A byte array that contains the encrypted data.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the inputElement parameter is null.

-or-

The value of the symmetricAlgorithm parameter is null.

Remarks

The returned byte array data is the value of the <CipherValue> element.

EncryptKey(Byte[],SymmetricAlgorithm)

Encrypts a key using a symmetric algorithm that a recipient uses to decrypt an <EncryptedData> element.

public static byte[] EncryptKey (byte[] keyData, System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm symmetricAlgorithm);
keyData
Byte[]

The key to encrypt.

symmetricAlgorithm
SymmetricAlgorithm

The symmetric key used to encrypt keyData.

Returns
Byte[]

A byte array that represents the encrypted value of the keyData parameter.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the keyData parameter is null.

-or-

The value of the symmetricAlgorithm parameter is null.

CryptographicException

The value of the symmetricAlgorithm parameter is not the Triple DES Key Wrap algorithm or the Advanced Encryption Standard (AES) Key Wrap algorithm (also called Rijndael).

Remarks

Use the EncryptKey method to encrypt the key that a recipient uses to decrypt an <EncryptedData> element. This method accepts a value for the symmetricAlgorithm parameter that represents either the Triple DES algorithm or the AES key wrap algorithm (also called Rijndael).

Note that this method does not automatically place the encrypted key within an <EncryptedKey> element. You must manually create the <EncryptedKey> element within your document.

EncryptKey(Byte[],RSA,Boolean)

Encrypts the key that a recipient uses to decrypt an <EncryptedData> element.

public static byte[] EncryptKey (byte[] keyData, System.Security.Cryptography.RSA rsa, bool useOAEP);
keyData
Byte[]

The key to encrypt.

rsa
RSA

The asymmetric key used to encrypt keyData.

useOAEP
Boolean

A value that specifies whether to use Optimal Asymmetric Encryption Padding (OAEP).

Returns
Byte[]

A byte array that represents the encrypted value of the keyData parameter.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the keyData parameter is null.

-or-

The value of the rsa parameter is null.

Remarks

Use the EncryptKey method to encrypt the key that a recipient uses to decrypt an <EncryptedData> element. This method accepts a value for rsa that represents either the RSA PKCS#1 v1.5 algorithm or the RSA PKCS#1 type 2 algorithm (also called OAEP).

Note that this method does not automatically place the encrypted key within an <EncryptedKey> element. You must manually create the <EncryptedKey> element within your document.

GetDecryptionIV(EncryptedData,String)

Retrieves the decryption initialization vector (IV) from an EncryptedData object.

public virtual byte[] GetDecryptionIV (System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData encryptedData, string symmetricAlgorithmUri);
encryptedData
EncryptedData

The EncryptedData object that contains the initialization vector (IV) to retrieve.

symmetricAlgorithmUri
String

The Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) that describes the cryptographic algorithm associated with the encryptedData value.

Returns
Byte[]

A byte array that contains the decryption initialization vector (IV).

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the encryptedData parameter is null.

CryptographicException

The value of the encryptedData parameter has an stem.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType.EncryptionMethod* property that is null.

-or-

The value of the symmetricAlgorithmUrisymAlgUri parameter is not a supported algorithm.

Remarks

Given an EncryptedData object, this method retrieves the decryption initialization vector (IV). The default behavior retrieves the IV as the first bytes of the CipherValue byte array.

For a list of Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) values supported by the symmetricAlgorithmUri parameter, see the list of constant fields associated with the EncryptedXml class.

GetDecryptionKey(EncryptedData,String)

Retrieves the decryption key from the specified EncryptedData object.

public virtual System.Security.Cryptography.SymmetricAlgorithm GetDecryptionKey (System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData encryptedData, string symmetricAlgorithmUri);
encryptedData
EncryptedData

The EncryptedData object that contains the decryption key to retrieve.

symmetricAlgorithmUri
String

The size of the decryption key to retrieve.

Returns
SymmetricAlgorithm

A SymmetricAlgorithm object associated with the decryption key.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the encryptedData parameter is null.

CryptographicException

The encryptedData parameter has an stem.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedType.EncryptionMethod* property that is null.

-or-

The encrypted key cannot be retrieved using the specified parameters.

Remarks

Given an EncryptedData object, this method looks for the decryption key that can be used to retrieve the plain text data. If a key name is specified, the method looks for the symmetric algorithm or asymmetric algorithm that is associated with the key name as defined in the key name mapping. Otherwise, if a retrieval method or an EncryptedKey object is specified, the method loads the EncryptedKey object and calls the GetDecryptionKey method.

GetIdElement(XmlDocument,String)

Determines how to resolve internal Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) references.

public virtual System.Xml.XmlElement GetIdElement (System.Xml.XmlDocument document, string idValue);
document
XmlDocument

An XmlDocument object that contains an element with an ID value.

idValue
String

A string that represents the ID value.

Returns
XmlElement

An XmlElement object that contains an ID indicating how internal Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs) are to be resolved.

Remarks

The GetIdElement method determines how to resolve internal Uniform Resource Identifiers (URIs). It looks for elements with a specified value or for elements with an ID attribute that has a specified value.

ReplaceData(XmlElement,Byte[])

Replaces an <EncryptedData> element with a specified decrypted sequence of bytes.

public void ReplaceData (System.Xml.XmlElement inputElement, byte[] decryptedData);
inputElement
XmlElement

The <EncryptedData> element to replace.

decryptedData
Byte[]

The decrypted data to replace inputElement with.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the inputElement parameter is null.

-or-

The value of the decryptedData parameter is null.

Remarks

The ReplaceData method replaces an <EncryptedData> element with the value of the decryptedData parameter.

ReplaceElement(XmlElement,EncryptedData,Boolean)

Replaces the specified element with the specified EncryptedData object.

public static void ReplaceElement (System.Xml.XmlElement inputElement, System.Security.Cryptography.Xml.EncryptedData encryptedData, bool content);
inputElement
XmlElement

The element to replace with an <EncryptedData> element.

encryptedData
EncryptedData

The EncryptedData object to replace the inputElement parameter with.

content
Boolean

true to replace only the contents of the element; false to replace the entire element.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The value of the inputElement parameter is null.

-or-

The value of the encryptedData parameter is null.

Remarks

The ReplaceElement method replaces the inputElement parameter with the value specified by the encryptedData parameter.
